Title: Assassin's Creed
Content: In February 2016, Ubisoft announced they would not be releasing a new game in 2016 in order to step "back and [re-examine] the "Assassin's Creed" franchise... [and take the] year to evolve the game mechanics and to make sure we're delivering on the promise of "Assassin's Creed" offering unique and memorable gameplay experiences". On the decision, Guillemot said that "Ubisoft started to question the annualized franchise with the release of "Assassin's Creed Unity", and the fact that "Assassin's Creed Syndicate" had "a slower launch than expected". Guillemot added that "by moving away from the annual iterations of the franchise, it will give the "Assassin's Creed" teams more time to take advantage of new engines and technology". "Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag"s director Ashraf Ismail, commented on an interview that he and the team would be interested in doing an "Assassin's Creed" game in an Ancient Egyptian setting, along with reiterating an earlier statement that a female leading character was not an impossibility for the series. In May 2017, Ubisoft confirmed the development of "Assassin's Creed Origins". It was announced to be set in the Ptolemaic Egypt in June 2017. The game was released worldwide on October 27, 2017 for PlayStation 4, Xbox One and Windows.

Title: Emily Stackhouse
Content: Au milieu des années 1840, le botaniste Charles Alexander Johns a vu les aquarelles de Stackhouse et lui a demandé de fournir des illustrations pour une série de livres d'histoire naturelle populaires qu'il publiait par le biais de la Société pour promouvoir les connaissances chrétiennes. Les deux premiers étaient "les arbres forestiers de la Grande-Bretagne" (1847) et "une semaine au lézard" (1848, en se concentrant sur la péninsule du lézard à Cornwall); Dans les deux, certaines des illustrations étaient des gravures basées sur des aquarelles de Stackhouse, non créditées, mais signées «E.S.» Cela a été suivi par le livre le plus connu de Johns, "Flowers of the Field", publié en deux volumes en 1851 avec plus de 200 illustrations non créditées de Stackhouse. Référé comme «la Bible du botaniste amateur», son succès a été tel qu'il était entré dans plus de 50 éditions et était toujours imprimé un siècle après sa première sortie. De plus, après la mort de Johns et Stackhouse, le SPCK a continué à utiliser les images de Stackhouse dans d'autres livres; On estime qu'ils avaient été imprimés dans au moins 15 et jusqu'à 30 livres différents à la fin du 19e siècle.

The Ganges Delta arises from the confluence of the rivers Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers and their respective tributaries. Document ID: 2
Title: Histoire du Bangladesh
Content: La décision d'effectuer la partition du Bengale a été annoncée en juillet 1905 par le vice-roi de l'Inde, Lord Curzon. La partition a eu lieu le 16 octobre 1905 et séparait les zones orientales largement musulmanes des zones occidentales en grande partie hindoues. L'ancienne province du Bengale a été divisée en deux nouvelles provinces "Bengale" (comprenant le Bengale occidental ainsi que la province du Bihar et de l'Orissa) et du Bengale oriental et de l'Assam avec Dacca comme capitale de la seconde. La partition a été promue pour des raisons administratives: le Bengale était géographiquement aussi important que la France et avait une population beaucoup plus importante. Curzon a déclaré que la région orientale était négligée et sous régime. En divisant la province, une administration améliorée pourrait être établie à l'est, où par la suite, la population bénéficierait de nouvelles écoles et de possibilités d'emploi. Les hindous du Bengale occidental qui ont dominé les affaires et la vie rurale du Bengale se plaignaient que la division en ferait une minorité dans une province qui incorporerait la province du Bihar et de l'Orissa. Les Indiens étaient indignés par ce qu'ils ont reconnu comme une politique de «diviser et règle».
---

Title: Église Notre Dame de Lourdes (Fall River, Massachusetts)
Content: La perte des messes de l'église a été transférée à l'orphelinat de St. Joseph jusqu'à ce qu'une nouvelle église puisse être construite. Les messes du samedi et du dimanche ont eu lieu à Bishop Connolly High School. Lorsque les ruines ont été fouillées, il a été constaté que très peu restait de l'incendie. Une fenêtre de verre taché, "le vol en Égypte", a été épargnée de destruction en raison du Connecticut pour réparation. Le troisième Notre Dame a été conçu et construit autour de cette fenêtre. Les trois anges qui avaient orné la lampe du sanctuaire et deux chandeliers, bien qu'au milieu de l'incendie, ont réussi à survivre à l'enfer. Ceux-ci font également partie de la nouvelle église. Le monument du Sacré-Cœur a également miraculeusement survécu à l'incendie même s'il était à proximité de l'église. Ce n'est qu'en 1986 que la nouvelle église a été construite et prête à l'emploi. L'orientation du nouveau bâtiment est inversée ce que l'ancien était. Les nouvelles églises "Front" se trouvent dans l'empreinte des anciennes églises "arrière". En 2012, il a été révélé que la paroisse de Notre Dame de Lourdes fusionnerait avec la paroisse de la conception immaculée à Fall River. Cela s'est produit en juin 2012 et ils utiliseront Notre-Dame comme église, prenant le nom de St. Bernadette.

claim: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child”
question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.
all_claims: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1].
To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1].
While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1].

Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.
claims_retained: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1].
To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sperm bank
Content: Where sperm banks are allowed to operate they are often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child, but which may also provide a compromise between the conflicting views which surround their operation. A particular example of this is the control which is often placed on the number of children which a single donor may father and which may be designed to protect against consanguinity. However, such legislation usually cannot prevent a sperm bank from supplying donor sperm outside the jurisdiction in which it operates, and neither can it prevent sperm donors from donating elsewhere during their lives. There is an acute shortage of sperm donors in many parts of the world and there is obvious pressure from many quarters for donor sperm from those willing and able to provide it to be made available as safely and as freely as possible.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Lois sur le don de sperme par pays
Content: En Israël, le don de sperme est mandaté par le ministère de la Santé. Il existe 12 banques de sperme et hôpitaux autorisés à travers le pays, et 2 autres dans des installations de recherche privées. Seuls les hommes célibataires et en bonne santé de moins de 30 ans sont autorisés à donner des spermatozoïdes, et ils sont financièrement compensés. Les hommes qui souhaitent faire un don doivent se rendre à l'hôpital, passer une interview et des contrôles sanguins. claim: To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father
question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.

Content: Le 22 octobre, 2 000 rebelles ont été tués lors de la bataille qui en résulte de Jajak Pass, la plus grande bataille de la province de Gangwon avant la guerre de Corée. Les rebelles manquaient de fusils et ils utilisaient des branches de bouleau comme armes. Ils manquaient également de pots et cuisent du riz sur la peau des bovins. En raison de l'étroitesse du col, les rebelles étaient bondés et il était facile pour les troupes de Maeng de tirer dans le camp et de tuer les rebelles. Maeng lui-même rapporte qu '"il était impossible de voir combien de personnes sont mortes", mais les descendants ont donné une estimation de 1 800 ~ 2 000. Les descendants rapportent également que la bataille s'est poursuivie pendant trois ou quatre jours. Le col de Seonang a été renommé Jajak Pass, car le sang a fait un son «Jajak» alors qu'il roulait sur la passe.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Tylenol (brand)
Content: The brand was introduced in 1955 by McNeil Laboratories, a family owned pharmaceutical manufacturer. Two brothers took over the company from their father that year, and that year one of them learned about paracetamol, which was not on the US market at that time. To avoid competing with aspirin, they marketed it as a product to reduce fever in children, packaging it like a red fire truck with the slogan, "for little hotheads". The name "Tylenol" and the generic name "acetaminophen" were generated by McNeil from the chemical name of the drug. Johnson & Johnson bought McNeil in 1959, and one year later the drug was made available over the counter.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Burson
Content: Lors d'une conférence de presse organisée par Burson-Marsteller en novembre 1982, Johnson & Johnson a introduit un nouvel emballage inviolable, devenant la première entreprise à introduire un emballage triple, qui est devenu plus tard la norme de l'industrie. La conférence a donné à Johnson & Johnson la possibilité d'annoncer qu'ils réintroduisaient les capsules de Tylenol sur le marché et remplaceraient tout Tylenol que les consommateurs avaient jeté. En outre, Johnson & Johnson a publié des publicités avec des coupons pour les consommateurs pour remplacer le Tylenol qui avait été jeté et avait produit des publicités et des publicités imprimées remerciant le public pour leur "confiance et soutien continus". Dans les six semaines suivant l'introduction du produit reconditionné, les ventes de Tylenol sont revenues au niveau précédent. En 1983, Burson-Marsteller a reçu une enclume en argent pour la «gestion de la crise hors de la ligne» pour son travail avec Johnson & Johnson. L'entreprise a été ramenée pour gérer la gestion des crises lors d'une deuxième crise de Tylenol, impliquant un souillage du cyanure à New York en 1986.
---

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Numerical digit
Content: From India, the thriving trade between Islamic sultans and Africa carried the concept to Cairo. Arabic mathematicians extended the system to include decimal fractions, and Muḥammad ibn Mūsā al-Ḵwārizmī wrote an important work about it in the 9th  century. The modern Arabic numerals were introduced to Europe with the translation of this work in the 12th century in Spain and Leonardo of Pisa's "Liber Abaci" of 1201. In Europe, the complete Indian system with the zero was derived from the Arabs in the 12th century.

Title: chiffres arabes
Content: Le système numérique hindou-arabique a été développé par des mathématiciens indiens autour de la MA 500 en utilisant des formes très différentes des chiffres. De l'Inde, le système a été adopté par les mathématiciens arabes à Bagdad et transmis aux Arabes plus à l'ouest. La forme actuelle des chiffres développée en Afrique du Nord. C'est dans la ville nord-africaine de Bejaia que le savant italien Fibonacci a rencontré pour la première fois les chiffres; Son travail était crucial pour les faire connaître dans toute l'Europe. L'utilisation de chiffres arabes s'est propagée dans le monde à travers le commerce européen, les livres et le colonialisme.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Antarctica
Content: Positioned asymmetrically around the South Pole and largely south of the Antarctic Circle, Antarctica is the southernmost continent and is surrounded by the Southern Ocean; alternatively, it may be considered to be surrounded by the southern Pacific, Atlantic, and Indian Oceans, or by the southern waters of the World Ocean. There are a number of rivers and lakes in Antarctica, the longest river being the Onyx. The largest lake, Vostok, is one of the largest sub-glacial lakes in the world. Antarctica covers more than , making it the fifth-largest continent, about 1.3 times as large as Europe. The coastline measures and is mostly characterised by ice formations, as the following table shows:
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Warren B. Hamilton
Content: Hamilton a dirigé une fête sur le terrain à deux en Antarctique (octobre 1958 à janvier 1959) pour l'année géophysique internationale et a lancé une nouvelle compréhension de l'Antarctique. Il a été le premier à appliquer le nom des montagnes trans-anarctiques (deux ans plus tard, formalisées comme des montagnes transantarctiques) à cette fourchette de 3 500 km. Hamilton a reconnu qu'un grand secteur de cette gamme contenait des roches granitiques distinctives comme la ceinture orogénique d'Adélaïde d'Australie du Sud. Les fossiles associés de divers âges en Antarctique, en Australie et en Afrique la plus au sud ont davantage lié ces continents, et ont soutenu les explications radicales de l'époque de la dérive continentale. Avant de se rendre en Antarctique, Hamilton a été ce qu'il a décrit plus tard comme un «drifter de placard», conscient que la géologie de l'hémisphère sud a fourni des preuves puissantes favorisant la dérive continentale. Il est retourné en Antarctique pour un travail sur le terrain en 1963 et 1964 dans d'autres parties des montagnes transantarctiques, y compris celles autrefois continues avec d'autres tracts australiens. Il a également enquêté sur les preuves sur le terrain de la dérive en Australie et en Afrique du Sud, intégrant son travail à celle d'autres chercheurs pour montrer comment l'Antarctique et d'autres continents du Gondwana s'étaient séparés.

In 2005, Centipede Press released a deluxe limited edition of "'Salem's Lot" with black and white photographs by Jerry Uelsmann and the two short stories "Jerusalem's Lot" and "One for the Road", as well as over 50 pages of deleted material. The book was limited to 315 copies, each signed by Stephen King and Jerry Uelsmann. The book was printed on 100# Mohawk Superfine paper, it measured , was over thick, and weighed more than . The book included a ribbon marker, head and tail bands, three-piece cloth construction, and a slipcase. An unsigned hardcover edition limited to 600 copies, was later released. Both the signed and unsigned editions were sold out. In an interview with the printed trade journal "Fine Books & Collections", King said of the illustrated folio version of his "'Salem's Lot", "I think it's beautiful!" A trade edition was later released.

Title: Le chat dans le chapeau
Content: Selon Judith et Neil Morgan, le livre s'est bien vendu immédiatement. L'édition commerciale a initialement vendu en moyenne 12 000 exemplaires par mois, un chiffre qui a augmenté rapidement. Bullock's Department Store à Los Angeles, en Californie, a vendu son premier ordre à 100 copies du livre en une journée et a rapidement réorganisé 250 autres. Les Morgans attribuent ces numéros de vente à "le bouche-à-oreille de jeu", affirmant que les enfants ont entendu parler du livre de leurs amis et ont harcelé leurs parents pour l'acheter pour eux. Cependant, l'édition scolaire de Houghton Mifflin ne s'est pas vendue aussi bien. Comme Geisel l'a noté dans le profil de Jonathan Cott en 1983, "Houghton Mifflin ... avait du mal à le vendre aux écoles; il y avait beaucoup de fidèles de Dick et Jane, et mon livre était considéré comme trop frais et irrévérencieux. Mais Bennett Cerf à Random House avait demandé des droits commerciaux, et cela venait de reprendre dans les librairies." Geisel a déclaré aux Morgans: "Les parents comprenaient mieux que les écoles la nécessité de ce genre de lecteur."

claim: Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion
question_en: Does cognitive dissonance factor into pluralistic ignorance?
report_en: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context. Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1]. Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1]. Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
all_claims: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context.

Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1].
Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1].

Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
claims_retained: Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1].
Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pluralistic ignorance
Content: Prentice and Miller found that, on average, private levels of comfort with drinking practices on campus were much lower than the perceived average. In the case of men, they found a shifting of private attitudes toward this perceived norm, a form of cognitive dissonance. Women, on the other hand, were found to have an increased sense of alienation on the campus but lacked the attitude change detected in men, presumably because norms related to alcohol consumption on campus are much more central for men than for women. Research has shown that pluralistic ignorance plagues not only those who indulge, but also those who abstain: from gambling, smoking and drinking and among some who follow vegetarianism. The latter has found that pluralistic ignorance can be caused by the structure of the underlying social network, not cognitive dissonance.

Title: Communication interpersonnelle
Content: Lorsque les individus rencontrent de nouvelles informations ou de nouvelles expériences, ils classent les informations en fonction de leurs attitudes, pensées et croyances préexistantes. Si la nouvelle rencontre ne coïncide pas avec leurs hypothèses préexistantes, la dissonance est susceptible de se produire. Lorsque la dissonance se produit, les individus sont motivés à réduire la dissonance qu'ils éprouvent en évitant les situations qui provoqueraient la dissonance ou augmenteraient la dissonance. Pour cette raison, la dissonance cognitive est considérée comme un État d'entraînement qui encourage la motivation à réaliser des consonances et à réduire la dissonance.
Un exemple de dissonance cognitive serait si quelqu'un croit que le maintien d'un mode de vie sain est important, mais il ne s'entraîne pas régulièrement ou ne mange pas en bonne santé. Ils peuvent ressentir une dissonance entre leurs croyances et leurs actions. S'il y a une quantité importante de dissonance, ils peuvent être motivés à changer leurs attitudes et à déterminer plus ou à manger des aliments plus sains. Ils peuvent également être enclins à éviter les situations qui souligneront le fait que leurs attitudes et leurs croyances sont incohérentes, comme éviter le gymnase ou ne pas lire les rapports de santé. Les relations consonantes sont lorsque deux éléments, tels que vos croyances et actions, sont en équilibre les uns avec les autres ou coïncidant. Les relations dissonantes sont lorsque deux éléments ne sont pas en équilibre et provoquent une dissonance. Des relations non pertinentes sont lorsque deux éléments ne possèdent pas une relation significative les uns avec les autres, ils ne sont pas liés et ne provoquent pas de dissonance.

Title: Emmerdale
Content: Emmerdale (known as Emmerdale Farm until 1989) is a British soap opera set in Emmerdale (known as Beckindale until 1994), a fictional village in the Yorkshire Dales. Created by Kevin Laffan, "Emmerdale Farm" was first broadcast on 16 October 1972. Produced by ITV Yorkshire, it has been filmed at their Leeds studio since its inception. The programme is broadcast in every ITV region.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kathleen Beedles
Content: De 1999 à 2001, Beedles a travaillé comme associé d'histoires sur "Coronation Street" avant de passer à "Emmerdale" en tant que rédacteur en chef de Story. En 2005, Beedles a été nommé producteur de séries de feuilleton à télévision britannique "Emmerdale", succédant à Steve Frost. Elle avait travaillé en tant que productrice et rédactrice en série pour le savon ITV avant de jouer le rôle. Pendant son temps sur le savon, elle était responsable de nombreux scénarios majeurs, notamment le scénario d'explosion de Kings River Showhome et l'intrigue en kidnappé de Tom King. Elle était également responsable de l'OMS qui a tué Tom King? Storyline, qui a été nominé pour le meilleur scénario aux British Soap Awards 2007. Sous son mandat, Emmerdale a été nominée pour un BAFTA pendant trois années consécutives, a remporté un prix RTS et le prix numérique Broadcast pour la chaîne en ligne Tom King qui a tué.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Wilt Chamberlain
Content: Wilton Norman Chamberlain (; August 21, 1936 – October 12, 1999) was an American basketball player who played center position and is considered one of the most prominent and dominant players in NBA history. He played for the Philadelphia/San Francisco Warriors, the Philadelphia 76ers, and the Los Angeles Lakers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He played for the University of Kansas and also for the Harlem Globetrotters before playing in the NBA. Chamberlain stood tall, and weighed as a rookie before bulking up to 275 and eventually to over with the Lakers.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Wilt Chamberlain
Content: Wilton Norman Chamberlain est né à Philadelphie, dans une famille de neuf enfants, le fils d'Olivia Ruth Johnson, travailleur domestique et femme au foyer, et William Chamberlain, soudeur, gardien et armature. Il était un enfant frêle, mourant presque de pneumonie dans ses premières années et manquant une année entière d'école en conséquence. Dans ses premières années, Chamberlain n'était pas intéressé par le basket-ball, car il pensait que c'était "un jeu pour les sissies". Au lieu de cela, il était un athlète passionné d'athlétisme: en tant que jeune, il a sauté en hauteur de 6 pieds, 6 pouces, a couru les 440 verges en 49,0 secondes et les 880 verges en 1: 58,3, a mis le tir de 53 pieds, 4 pouces et un large a sauté 22 pieds. Mais selon Chamberlain, "le basket-ball était roi à Philadelphie", alors il s'est finalement tourné vers le sport. Parce que Chamberlain était un enfant très grand, mesurant déjà à l'âge de 10 ans et quand il est entré au lycée Overbrook de Philadelphie, il avait un avantage naturel contre ses pairs; Il a rapidement été réputé pour son talent de notation, sa force physique et ses capacités de blocage de tir. Selon le journaliste ESPN Hal Bock, Chamberlain était "effrayant et effrayant ... avant son arrivée, la plupart des basketteurs étaient des hommes de la taille d'un mortel. Chamberlain a changé cela." C'était aussi dans cette période de sa vie où ses trois surnoms de toujours "Wilt the Still", "Goliath" et son préféré, "The Big Dipper", auraient été nés.
---

Title: Georgios Papadopoulos
Content: Traduit par:
Une tentative d'assassinat ratée contre Papadopoulos a été perpétrée par Alexandros Panagoulis le matin du 13 août 1968, lorsque Papadopoulos a été chassé de sa résidence d'été à Lagonisi à Athènes, escortée par sa moto et ses voitures de sécurité personnelle. Panagoulis a enflammé une bombe à un point de la route côtière où la limousine transportant des papadopoulos devrait ralentir, mais la bombe n'a pas nui à Papadopoulos. Panagoulis a été capturé quelques heures plus tard dans une grotte maritime à proximité, car le bateau envoyé pour l'aider à s'échapper a été invité à partir à un moment précis et il ne pouvait pas y nager à temps en raison de fortes courants maritimes. Après son arrestation, il a été emmené dans les bureaux de la police militaire grecque (Eat-ESA) où il a été interrogé, battu et torturé. Le 17 novembre 1968, Panagoulis a été condamné à mort mais a été personnellement pardonné par Papadopoulos, n'a purgé que cinq ans de prison et après la restauration de la démocratie a été élu député. Il était considéré comme une figure emblématique de la lutte pour restaurer la démocratie, et en tant que telle a souvent été parallèle à Harmodius et Aristogeiton, deux anciens Athéniens connus pour leur tyrannicide assassinat d'Hipparque.
---

claim: Samuelsson and his colleagues, who identified it as a metabolite of arachidonic acid produced by rabbit neutrophils
question_en: Who discovered 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid?
report_en: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (5-HETE) was first discovered and described in 1976 by the Nobel laureate Bengt I. Samuelsson and his colleagues, who identified it as a metabolite of arachidonic acid produced by rabbit neutrophils [1].
all_claims: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (5-HETE) was first discovered and described in 1976 by the Nobel laureate Bengt I.
Samuelsson and his colleagues, who identified it as a metabolite of arachidonic acid produced by rabbit neutrophils [1].
claims_retained: Samuelsson and his colleagues, who identified it as a metabolite of arachidonic acid produced by rabbit neutrophils [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid
Content: The Nobel laureate, Bengt I. Samuelsson, and colleagues first described 5("S")-HETE in 1976 as a metabolite of arachidonic acid made by rabbit neutrophils. Biological activity was linked to it several years later when it was found to stimulate human neutrophil rises in cytosolic calcium, chemotaxis, and increases in their cell surface adhesiveness as indicated by their aggregation to each other. Since a previously discovered arachidonic acid metabolite made by neutrophils, leukotriene B4 (LTB), also stimulates human neutrophil calcium rises, chemotaxis, and auto-aggregation and is structurally similar to 5("S")-HETE in being a 5-("S")-hydroxy-eicosateraenoate, it was assumed that 5-("S")-HETE stimulated cells through the same cell surface receptors as those used by (LTB) viz., the leukotriene B4 receptors. However, further studies in neutrophils indicated that 5-("S")-HETE acts through a receptor distinct from that used by LTB as well as various other neutrophil stimuli. This 5("S")-HETE receptor is termed the oxoeicosanoid receptor 1 (abbreviated as (OXER1).
---

Title: Acide 5-hydroxyeicosatetraenoïque
Content: L'acide 5-hydroxyeicosatetraenoïque (5-HETE, 5 ("S") - Hete, ou 5 "S" -Hete) est un eicosanoïde, c'est-à-dire un métabolite d'acide arachidonique. Il est produit par divers types de cellules chez l'homme et d'autres espèces animales. Ces cellules peuvent ensuite métaboliser l'acide formé 5 ("S") - à l'acide 5-oxo-eicosatetraenoïque (5-oxo-ete), 5 ("s"), 15 ("s") - dihydroxyeicosatetraenoïque (5-oxo-15 ("s") - hete).
---

Title: Chlore
Content: Le chlore est un élément chimique avec le symbole CL et le numéro atomique 17. Le deuxième plus léger des halogènes, il apparaît entre le fluor et le brome dans le tableau périodique et ses propriétés sont principalement intermédiaires entre elles. Le chlore est un gaz jaune-vert à température ambiante. Il s'agit d'un élément extrêmement réactif et d'un fort agent oxydant: parmi les éléments, il a l'affinité électronique la plus élevée et la troisième électronégativité la plus élevée, derrière l'oxygène et le fluor uniquement.

claim: Kazakhstan operates as a unitary presidential republic in which executive authority is centered on the president, while legislative power is exercised by a bicameral Parliament composed of the Mazhilis (lower house) and the Senate (upper house); the Senate has two indirectly elected members from each region, the city of republican importance (Almaty) and the capital, plus fifteen presidential appointees intended to reflect the nation’s ethnic and cultural diversity, and its 6-year terms are staggered so that half the chamber is renewed every three years
question_en: What type of government does Kazakhastan have?
report_en: Kazakhstan operates as a unitary presidential republic in which executive authority is centered on the president, while legislative power is exercised by a bicameral Parliament composed of the Mazhilis (lower house) and the Senate (upper house); the Senate has two indirectly elected members from each region, the city of republican importance (Almaty) and the capital, plus fifteen presidential appointees intended to reflect the nation’s ethnic and cultural diversity, and its 6-year terms are staggered so that half the chamber is renewed every three years [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Senate of Kazakhstan
Content: The Senate of Kazakhastan (, "Qazaqstan Parlamentiniń Senaty") is the upper house of two chambers in Kazakhstan's legislature, known as the Parliament ("Parlamenti"). The Senate is composed of elected members - two from each region, the city of republican importance (Almaty) and the capital city of the Republic of Kazakhstan at joint sessions of the members of all representative bodies of respective regions, city of the republican importance and the capital city of the Republic.
Members of the Senate are elected on the basis of indirect suffrage by secret ballot. Half of elected members of the Senate are up for election every three years.
Fifteen members are appointed by the President of Kazakhstan with the view to ensure representation for all the diverse national, cultural components of society.
The term of office for the members of the Senate is 6 years.
According to constitutional norms in the Parliament of the fifth convocation, members of the Senate elected in 2011 and 2014 and those appointed by the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan in 2011 and 2013 continue to hold office.

question_en: When was activity theory created?
report_en: Activity theory, which emphasizes that successful ageing involves remaining socially and physically active, was formulated by American gerontologist Robert J. Havighurst in 1961, making that year its point of creation and formal introduction into gerontological discourse [1].
all_claims: Activity theory, which emphasizes that successful ageing involves remaining socially and physically active, was formulated by American gerontologist Robert J.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Activity theory (aging)
Content: The activity theory, also known as the implicit theory of aging, normal theory of aging, and lay theory of aging, proposes that successful ageing occurs when older adults stay active and maintain social interactions. It takes the view that the aging process is delayed and the quality of life is enhanced when old people remain socially active. 
The activity theory rose in opposing response to the disengagement theory. The activity theory and the disengagement theory were the two major theories that outlined successful aging in the early 1960s. The theory was developed by Robert J. Havighurst in 1961. In 1964, Bernice Neugarten asserted that satisfaction in old age depended on active maintenance of personal relationships and endeavors.

Content: À la maintenance pratiquement inconnue en dehors de l'Union soviétique jusqu'au milieu des années 80, lorsqu'il a été récupéré par des chercheurs scandinaves. La première conférence internationale sur la théorie de l'activité n'a eu lieu qu'en 1986. Le premier article non soviétique cité par Nardi est un article de 1987 de Yrjö Engeström: "Learning by Expanding". Cela a abouti à une reformulation d'AT. Kuutti note que le terme «théorie de l'activité» peut être utilisé dans deux sens: se référant à la tradition soviétique originale ou se référant à la communauté internationale et multi-voix appliquant les idées originales et en les développer davantage.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: In 1952, when the San Antonio Brewing Association changed its name to the Pearl Brewing Company, the triple Xs joined the Pearl name as a dominant image on the product and the company as a whole. The triple Xs were back on the company logo and were used on almost all of Pearl's advertisements. The Xs held this significant role to the end of production at the brewery in 2001, when the brewery closed its doors and the company logo was abandoned. As production of Pearl and Pearl Light spun up at Miller's Fort Worth facility, the product logos were redesigned. The updated label does not use the triple Xs, so a significant part of company identity has been virtually eliminated from the Pearl beers. However, Pearl's Country Club malt liquor still displays the XXXs in its logo.
Many people wonder where the Xs came from, and how were they ever used on beer. In truth, the three Xs are actually a quality rating system. The system was initially used in Europe during the 16th Century. As European royalty traveled their lands and visited neighboring counties, a royal courier was sent ahead of the official party. The courier's job was to sample beer at inns along the way. If the beer was only average, the courier would mark the inn's sign or door with a single X. If the inn's beer was deemed good, the sign or door would receive two Xs. A mark on an inn of three Xs meant that the beer inside was excellent, and a must-stop for the royal court as they passed through.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: Les Triple XS ont été adoptés par la San Antonio Brewing Association pour représenter deux choses: la haute qualité de leurs bières et la fierté que les travailleurs ont mis dans leurs produits. Les Triple XS peuvent être partis des logos de bière de compagnie et de perles, mais il n'a pas complètement disparu. Dans les années 1960, Pearl a absorbé la Goetz Brewing Company et a fait de Country Club Malt Liquor l'un des principaux produits de Pearl. Lorsque Country Club a reçu sa seule cure de jouvence de produits quelques années après le rachat, il a gagné le Triple XS dans son logo. Les X étaient situés dans le centre supérieur de la couronne du logo. Country Club est toujours produit aujourd'hui, et il porte toujours la marque «xxx» de Pearl.
---

claim: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion
question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
report_en: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1]. When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1]. Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1]. Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].
all_claims: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1].

When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1].

Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1].
Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Nerve injury
Content: Surgery can be done in case a nerve has become cut or otherwise divided. Recovery of a nerve after surgical repair depends mainly on the age of the patient. Young children can recover close-to-normal nerve function. In contrast, a patient over 60 years old with a cut nerve in the hand would expect to recover only protective sensation, that is, the ability to distinguish hot/cold or sharp/dull. Many other factors also affect nerve recovery. The use of autologous nerve grafting procedures that involve redirection of regenerative donor nerve fibers into the graft conduit has been successful in restoring target muscle function. Localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors may help promote the rate of axon regeneration observed within these graft conduits.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Bloc neurolytique
Content: Un bloc neurolytique est une forme de bloc nerveux impliquant la lésion délibérée d'un nerf par congélation ou chauffage ("neurotomie") ou l'application de produits chimiques ("neurolyse"). Ces interventions provoquent une dégénérescence des fibres du nerf et des interférences temporaires (quelques mois, généralement) avec la transmission des signaux nerveux. Dans ces procédures, la mince couche de protection autour de la fibre nerveuse, la lame basale, est conservée de sorte que, à mesure qu'une fibre endommagée reproduit, elle se déplace dans son tube de lame basale et se connecte à l'extrémité lâche correcte, et la fonction peut être restaurée. Couper chirurgical d'un nerf (neurrectomie), sépare ces tubes de lame basale, et sans eux pour canaliser les fibres de repousse vers leurs connexions perdues, au fil du temps, un névrome douloureux ou une douleur de désafférentation peut se développer. C'est pourquoi le neurolytique est généralement préféré au bloc chirurgical.
---

Title: Nerve injury
Content: Surgery can be done in case a nerve has become cut or otherwise divided. Recovery of a nerve after surgical repair depends mainly on the age of the patient. Young children can recover close-to-normal nerve function. In contrast, a patient over 60 years old with a cut nerve in the hand would expect to recover only protective sensation, that is, the ability to distinguish hot/cold or sharp/dull. Many other factors also affect nerve recovery. The use of autologous nerve grafting procedures that involve redirection of regenerative donor nerve fibers into the graft conduit has been successful in restoring target muscle function. Localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors may help promote the rate of axon regeneration observed within these graft conduits.

Title: Bloc neurolytique
Content: Un bloc neurolytique est une forme de bloc nerveux impliquant la lésion délibérée d'un nerf par congélation ou chauffage ("neurotomie") ou l'application de produits chimiques ("neurolyse"). Ces interventions provoquent une dégénérescence des fibres du nerf et des interférences temporaires (quelques mois, généralement) avec la transmission des signaux nerveux. Dans ces procédures, la mince couche de protection autour de la fibre nerveuse, la lame basale, est conservée de sorte que, à mesure qu'une fibre endommagée reproduit, elle se déplace dans son tube de lame basale et se connecte à l'extrémité lâche correcte, et la fonction peut être restaurée. Couper chirurgical d'un nerf (neurrectomie), sépare ces tubes de lame basale, et sans eux pour canaliser les fibres de repousse vers leurs connexions perdues, au fil du temps, un névrome douloureux ou une douleur de désafférentation peut se développer. C'est pourquoi le neurolytique est généralement préféré au bloc chirurgical.

Title: Pythagorean theorem
Content: There is debate whether the Pythagorean theorem was discovered once, or many times in many places, and the date of first discovery is uncertain, as is the date of the first proof. According to Joran Friberg, a historian of mathematics, evidence indicates that the Pythagorean theorem "was well-known to the mathematicians of the Old Babylonian period" (20th to 16th centuries BC), which would have been over a thousand years before Pythagoras was born. The history of the theorem can be divided into four parts: knowledge of Pythagorean triples, knowledge of the relationship among the sides of a right triangle, knowledge of the relationships among adjacent angles, and proofs of the theorem within some deductive system.

Les triplets pythagoriens se produisent lorsque les trois côtés d'un triangle droit sont des entiers tels que a = 3, b = 4 et c = 5. Une tablette d'argile montre que les Babyloniens connaissaient les triples pythagoriques 1200 ans avant Pytheragore, mais personne ne sait s'ils connaissaient le théorème pythagore plus général. La preuve chinoise utilise quatre triangles similaires pour prouver le théorème.

Title: Andes Chocolate Mints
Content: In 1921, Andrew Kanelos opened a small candy store in Chicago, Illinois. While he initially called his store "Andy's Candies" in reference to himself, he quickly found that men did not like giving boxes of candy with another man's name to their wives and girlfriends. As such, he changed the spelling of the business to "Andes Candies." In 1980, Andes was purchased by the Swiss candy company Interfood (later Jacobs Suchard). When Jacobs Suchard bought Brach's in 1987, Andes became part of that division. When Jacobs Suchard was sold to Kraft General Foods in 1990, Brach's was kept separate by owner Klaus J. Jacobs. In need of cash, Brach's sold Andes to Tootsie Roll Industries in 2000.

Content: The , JMSDF, also referred to as the Japanese Navy, is the maritime warfare branch of the Japan Self-Defense Forces, tasked with the naval defense of Japan. It is the "de facto" navy of Japan and was formed following the dissolution of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) after World War II. The JMSDF has a fleet of 154 ships and 346 aircraft and consists of approximately 45,800 personnel. Its main tasks are to maintain control of the nation's sea lanes and to patrol territorial waters. It also participates in UN-led peacekeeping operations (PKOs) and Maritime Interdiction Operations (MIOs).

claim: A specialist who focuses on the design, fabrication, and fitting of complete or partial dentures is commonly called a prosthodontist or, in jurisdictions where they are licensed, a denturist; both professionals possess advanced training specifically aimed at producing comfortable, functional dentures and managing related oral-rehabilitation issues
question_en: What is a denture specialist called?
report_en: A specialist who focuses on the design, fabrication, and fitting of complete or partial dentures is commonly called a prosthodontist or, in jurisdictions where they are licensed, a denturist; both professionals possess advanced training specifically aimed at producing comfortable, functional dentures and managing related oral-rehabilitation issues [1].
all_claims: A specialist who focuses on the design, fabrication, and fitting of complete or partial dentures is commonly called a prosthodontist or, in jurisdictions where they are licensed, a denturist; both professionals possess advanced training specifically aimed at producing comfortable, functional dentures and managing related oral-rehabilitation issues [1].
claims_retained: A specialist who focuses on the design, fabrication, and fitting of complete or partial dentures is commonly called a prosthodontist or, in jurisdictions where they are licensed, a denturist; both professionals possess advanced training specifically aimed at producing comfortable, functional dentures and managing related oral-rehabilitation issues [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Dentures
Content: The fabrication of a set of complete dentures is a challenge for any dentist/denturist. There are many axioms in the production of dentures that must be understood; ignorance of one axiom can lead to failure of the denture. In the vast majority of cases, complete dentures should be comfortable soon after insertion, although almost always at least two adjustment visits are necessary to remove the cause of sore spots. One of the most critical aspects of dentures is that the impression of the denture must be perfectly made and used with perfect technique to make an accurate model of the patient's edentulous (toothless) gums. The dentist or denturist must use a process called border molding to ensure that the denture flanges are properly extended. An array of problems may occur if the final impression of the denture is not made properly. It takes considerable patience and experience for a dentist to know how to make a denture, and for this reason it may be in the patient's best interest to seek a specialist, either a prosthodontist or denturist, to make the denture. A denturist is a trained and licensed professional who sees patients in need of dentures, partials, relines or repairs. A denturist not only takes the impression, but makes the entire denture in his or her own laboratory. The denturist then schedules a date for the delivery of the finished dentures to the patient. A general dentist may do a good job making dentures, but only if he or she is meticulous and experienced. Many dentists no longer make dentures themselves. but instead take an impression of the patients' mouth and then either send the impressions to a dental laboratory, which could be anywhere in the world, or send the patient to a denturist. Once the laboratory receives dental impressions of the patient's mouth, the laboratory creates plaster molds from them. The laboratory uses the molds to create the wax rims used to register the patient's bite. These wax rims are returned to the dentist, who uses them to register the patient's bite. The dentist may assist the patient in choosing the correct size of teeth for the dentures, or simply make the selection himself. Once bite registration is completed and the teeth are selected for the dentures, the wax rim is usually returned to the dental laboratory in order to have the denture teeth set into the wax. Once the teeth are set into the wax rim, the result is a prefinished denture that looks almost like the finished product. This prefinished denture is usually returned to the dentist's office and the patient usually has a chance to approve the setup (for immediate or standard dentures) or to try the denture before it is finished. After approval by the patient, the dentist returns the pre-denture to the laboratory for final processing. The finished denture is then returned to the dentist's office for delivery to the patient.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Nettoyeur de prothèse
Content: Un nettoyant de prothèse (également appelé nettoyant dentaire), est un nettoyant utilisé pour nettoyer les prothèses dentaires lorsqu'elles sont hors de la bouche. Leur utilisation principale est de contrôler la croissance des micro-organismes sur les prothèses dentaires, en particulier des «candida albicans», empêchant ainsi la stomatite liée à la prothèse. Lorsque des prothèses dentaires sont portées dans la bouche, un biofilm se développe qui peut être similaire à la plaque dentaire. Il peut devenir durci et minéralisé comme calcul dentaire. Les nettoyants de prothèse sont également utilisés pour éliminer les taches et autres débris qui peuvent être causés par le régime alimentaire, la consommation de tabac, la consommation de café, la consommation de thé, etc.
---

claim: Male–lion infanticide occurs chiefly when a new dominant male or coalition takes over a pride; by killing nursing cubs that are not his, he removes future rivals and, crucially, causes the mothers to stop lactating and return to estrus sooner, giving him an earlier chance to mate and pass on his own genes, so the behavior is favored by natural selection and persists in the population
question_en: Why do lions kill their own cubs?
report_en: Male–lion infanticide occurs chiefly when a new dominant male or coalition takes over a pride; by killing nursing cubs that are not his, he removes future rivals and, crucially, causes the mothers to stop lactating and return to estrus sooner, giving him an earlier chance to mate and pass on his own genes, so the behavior is favored by natural selection and persists in the population [1].
all_claims: Male–lion infanticide occurs chiefly when a new dominant male or coalition takes over a pride; by killing nursing cubs that are not his, he removes future rivals and, crucially, causes the mothers to stop lactating and return to estrus sooner, giving him an earlier chance to mate and pass on his own genes, so the behavior is favored by natural selection and persists in the population [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sociobiology
Content: For example, newly dominant male lions often kill cubs in the pride that they did not sire. This behavior is adaptive because killing the cubs eliminates competition for their own offspring and causes the nursing females to come into heat faster, thus allowing more of his genes to enter into the population. Sociobiologists would view this instinctual cub-killing behavior as being inherited through the genes of successfully reproducing male lions, whereas non-killing behavior may have died out as those lions were less successful in reproducing.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Lion
Content: Lorsqu'ils ont été introduits pour la première fois au reste de la fierté, les lion Cubs manquent de confiance lorsqu'ils sont confrontés à des adultes autres que leur mère. Cependant, ils commencent bientôt à s'immerger dans la vie de la fierté, jouant entre eux ou en essayant d'initier le jeu avec les adultes. Les lionnes avec leurs propres oursons sont plus susceptibles d'être tolérantes envers les oursons d'une autre lionne que les lionnes sans petits. La tolérance masculine des oursons varie - parfois un mâle laisse patiemment les Cubs jouer avec sa queue ou sa crinière, tandis qu'un autre peut grogner et battre les Cubs.
Le sevrage se produit après six ou sept mois. Les lions mâles atteignent la maturité à environ trois ans et à quatre à cinq ans sont capables de stimuler et de déplacer les hommes adultes associés à une autre fierté. Ils commencent à vieillir et s'affaiblissent entre 10 et 15 ans au plus tard. Lorsqu'un ou plusieurs nouveaux mâles évincé les hommes précédents associés à une fierté, les vainqueurs tuent souvent tous les jeunes Cubs existants, peut-être parce que les femmes ne deviennent pas fertiles et réceptives jusqu'à ce que leurs petits mûrissent ou meurent. Les femelles défendent souvent farouchement leurs oursons d'un homme usurpant, mais ne réussissent rarement pas à moins qu'un groupe de trois ou quatre mères de fierté de joindre ses forces contre le mâle. Les Cubs meurent également de famine et d'abandon et de prédation par des léopards, des hyènes et des chiens sauvages. Jusqu'à 80% des Lion Cubs mourront avant l'âge de deux ans.

question_en: What does nerfing mean?
report_en: In video-game design, “nerfing” refers to deliberately reducing the power, desirability, or overall effectiveness of a specific game element—such as a weapon, ability, or character—in order to improve balance and fairness; the term functions both as a noun (“a nerf”) and a verb (“to nerf”) [1]. The expression originated among players of the 1997 MMORPG Ultima Online, where frustrated users likened weakened virtual weapons to foam Nerf-brand toys whose soft projectiles are unlikely to cause serious harm, highlighting how the adjustment makes an element less threatening without removing it entirely [1].

Les guerres de nerf peuvent avoir lieu n'importe où. Toute zone ayant un bon équilibre entre l'espace ouvert et la couverture peut être un candidat. Les sous-sols, les bureaux et les arrière-cours sont des emplacements communs pour les jeux informels. Pour les grandes guerres avec plus de participants, des lieux plus grands comme les gymnases, les parcs publics, les forêts, les ravins et les écoles font de bonnes aires de jeux. L'intérieur d'une grande salle comme une pièce peut être transformé en champ de bataille en tournant des tables sur leurs côtés. Lors de la planification d'une guerre Nerf dans une zone publique, l'organisateur se réserve généralement l'espace et regarde les non-participants afin de réduire toute responsabilité. La possibilité de jouer dans des emplacements gratuits est un élément important de l'accessibilité d'une guerre Nerf.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Game Show Network
Content: Game Show Network launched at 7:00 p.m. ET on December 1, 1994. The first aired game show was "What's My Line?". From 1994 until about 1997, the network aired classic pre-1972 game shows as well as game shows made after 1972, most of which came from the Mark Goodson–Bill Todman library. The network aired game shows in a 24-hour cycle, and also used live interstitials as wraparound programming. In its first few months, GSN's commercials consisted of public service announcements (PSAs), promotions for its programming and commercials related to network parent company Sony. By 1995, when the network began to expand, the network began accepting conventional advertising as it gained new sponsorships. On March 17, 1997, the Game Show Network rebranded with a new presentation package and a new logo (which had the network's name in boxes and a colorful swirling ball) and a new slogan "All Play, All Day". While the logo changed, its programming remained unchanged, the network also debuted new promos and new idents on that day, which were designed by graphics agency Lee Hunt Associates.

En 1999, le réseau a lancé une liste de programmes originaux, dont "Inhizition", "All New 3's A Crowd" et "Hollywood Showdown". La chaîne a également lancé des émissions originales telles que "Extreme Gong" (un remake du classique "Gong Show"). En 2000, le réseau a été confronté à un autre revers lorsque GSN a perdu les droits à diffuser "The Price Is Right", le dernier épisode diffusé le 3 avril de la même année.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Specialty drugs in the United States
Content: Specialty drugs or specialty pharmaceuticals are a recent designation of pharmaceuticals that are classified as high-cost, high complexity and/or high touch. Specialty drugs are often biologics—"drugs derived from living cells" that are injectable or infused (although some are oral medications). They are used to treat complex or rare chronic conditions such as cancer, rheumatoid arthritis, hemophilia, H.I.V. psoriasis, inflammatory bowel disease and hepatitis C. In 1990 there were 10 specialty drugs on the market, in the mid-1990s there were fewer than 30, by 2008 there were 200, and by 2015 there were 300. Drugs are often defined as specialty because their price is much higher than that of non-specialty drugs. Medicare defines any drug for which the negotiated price is $670 per month or more, as a specialty drug which is placed in a specialty tier that requires a higher patient cost sharing. Drugs are also identified as specialty when there is a special handling requirement or the drug is only available via a limited distributions network. By 2015 "specialty medications accounted for one-third of all spending on drugs in the United States, up from 19 percent in 2004 and heading toward 50 percent in the next 10 years", according to IMS Health, which tracks prescriptions. According to a 2010 article in Forbes, specialty drugs for rare diseases became more expensive "than anyone imagined" and their success came "at a time when the traditional drug business of selling medicines to the masses" was "in decline". In 2015 analysis by "The Wall Street Journal" suggested the large premium was due to the perceived value of rare disease treatments which usually are very expensive when compared to treatments for more common diseases.
---

Ces médicaments ont été désignés comme des médicaments spécialisés et des pharmacies spécialisées. La combinaison de 5 critères: guide de médicaments, plan de communication, éléments pour assurer une utilisation sûre, un système de mise en œuvre et des horaires pour la soumission des évaluations "." En 2010, 48% de toutes les nouvelles entités moléculaires et 60% de toutes les nouvelles approbations de médicaments spécialisées, nécessitaient un programme SEMS. "

Title: Bangkok Noi District
Content: Bangkok Noi was established as an amphoe on 15 October 1915. Originally named Amphoe Ammarin, it was renamed on 11 July 1916 to Amphoe Bangkok Noi to match with the historical name of the area. It became a khet in 1972 when Thon Buri and Bangkok were merged. Later on 9 November 1989 the Bang Phlat district was created from four of Bangkok Noi's sub-districts, leaving Bangkok Noi with four remaining sub-districts: Siri Rat, Ban Chang Lo, Bang Khun Non, and Bang Khun Si. On 12 December 1991 a small part of Bang Phlat district was moved back to Bangkok Noi, creating the new Arun Ammarin sub-district.

claim: Archaeological and traditional evidence indicate that the first human settlement of New Zealand occurred when Polynesian ancestors of the Māori arrived between AD 1280 and 1320, marking the beginning of continuous habitation in the islands
question_en: When was New Zealand first settled?

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: History of the Otago Region
Content: The precise date at which the first inhabitants of New Zealand reached Otago and the extreme south (known to later Māori as "Murihiku") remains uncertain. Māori descend from a race of Polynesian sea-wanderers who, moved from East Asia and south-east Asia to the islands of the Pacific. Tradition tells of their further journeyings from Hawaiki to New Zealand, and some commentators have identified this homeland as Havai'i, an island in the Society Group. Overpopulation, scarcity of food and civil war forced many of them to migrate once more, and New Zealand became their new home. Māori settled New Zealand between AD 1280–1320. They quickly learnt to hunt the numerous species of moa and seals in New Zealand and settled across the North and South islands in less than a few decades. There is a change in the pollen record from inland Otago from 600 years ago from a forest to bracken flora. It has been inferred that this relates to fires being lit during Maori exploration.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Histoire de la Nouvelle-Zélande
Content: L'histoire de la Nouvelle-Zélande remonte à au moins 700 ans pour avoir été découverte et établie par les Polynésiens, qui ont développé une culture maorie distincte centrée sur des liens et des terres. Le premier explorateur européen à voir la Nouvelle-Zélande a été le navigateur néerlandais Abel Tasman le 13 décembre 1642. Les néerlandais ont également été les premiers non-autochtones à explorer et à tracer le littoral de la Nouvelle-Zélande. Le capitaine James Cook, qui a atteint la Nouvelle-Zélande en octobre 1769 lors du premier de ses trois voyages, a été le premier explorateur européen à faire le tour et à cartographier la Nouvelle-Zélande. À la fin du XVIIIe siècle, le pays était régulièrement visité par des explorateurs et autres marins, missionnaires, commerçants et aventuriers. En 1840, le traité de Waitangi a été signé entre la Couronne britannique et divers chefs maoris, amenant la Nouvelle-Zélande dans l'Empire britannique et donnant aux Māori les mêmes droits que les sujets britanniques. Il y avait une vaste colonie britannique tout au long du reste du siècle et jusqu'au début du siècle prochain. La guerre et l'imposition d'un système économique et juridique européen ont conduit à la majeure partie des terres de la Nouvelle-Zélande qui passent des maoris à la propriété de Pākehā (européenne), et la plupart des Maoris sont devenus appauvris.
---

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Cricket bat
Content: The "blade" of a cricket bat is a wooden block that is generally flat on the striking face and with a ridge on the reverse (back) which concentrates wood in the middle where the ball is generally hit. The bat is traditionally made from willow wood, specifically from a variety of white willow called cricket bat willow ("Salix alba" var. "caerulea"), treated with raw (unboiled) linseed oil, which has a protective function. claim: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins
question_en: What happens when the president and VP of the USA die?
report_en: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency. If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1]. Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
all_claims: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency.

If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
claims_retained: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: President-elect of the United States
Content: If the Vice President-elect dies or resigns "before" the meeting of the Electoral College in December, the National Committee of the winning party would, in consultation with the president-elect, choose a replacement to receive the electoral votes of the Vice Presidential nominee in the same manner as would happen if the former Vice Presidential nominee had become President-elect due to the death of the apparent winner. Assuming the requisite number the electors agreed to vote for the replacement candidate, that person would then become the Vice President-elect. If such a vacancy were to occur "after" the electoral votes had been cast in the states, most authorities maintain that no replacement would be chosen and the new President (after taking office) would nominate a Vice President, per the provisions of the Twenty-fifth Amendment to the Constitution.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Constitution américaine
Content: Le vingt-cinquième amendement (1967) clarifie ce qui se passe au décès, au déménagement ou à la démission du président ou du vice-président et comment la présidence est temporairement remplie si le président devient handicapé et ne peut assumer les responsabilités du bureau. Il remplace la règle de succession ambiguë établie dans. Un plan concret de succession a été nécessaire à plusieurs reprises depuis 1789. Cependant, pour près de 20% de l'histoire des États-Unis, il n'y a pas eu de vice-président qui peut assumer la présidence.
---

claim: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation
question_en: Does Buddhism believe in Jesus?
report_en: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1]. While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1]. Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
all_claims: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
claims_retained: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1].

Title: Buddhism and Christianity

Title: Shinji Takahashi (chef religieux)
Content: Takahashi a prêché que le bouddhisme et le christianisme à l'âge actuel sont devenus académiques, ou formalisés et transformés en foi basés sur d'autres pouvoirs. En réponse à cela, il a préconisé de retourner à l'époque de Gotama Siddhartha et de Jésus-Christ dans beaucoup de ses œuvres littéraires, en commençant par "" Ningen / Shaka "" ("Les êtres humains / Gotama Bouddha"). De plus, Takahashi a souligné que ni Jésus-Christ ni Gotama Siddhartha ne prêchaient du tout les pensées d'autres pouvoirs, et que le christianisme et le bouddhisme à leur époque respective n'étaient pas compliqués comme le christianisme et le bouddhisme d'aujourd'hui. En ce qui concerne les pensées d'autres pouvoirs influençant ces religions, ces lois de la nature (la pure base religieuse du bouddhisme, de l'islam et du christianisme) se sont transformées à la suite des intentions de ceux qui étaient au pouvoir au fil du temps, ainsi que des interprétations des nombreux chercheurs; Les noyaux de ces lois de la nature ont été perdus, diverses théories sont devenues mitigées et elles sont devenues académises d'une manière complexe et ont perdu leur substance. En outre, ces lois de la nature ont été intentionnellement déformées et transmises aux gens aux fins de l'individu, et les gens ont été faits de croire que ceux qui ont obstrué cela se réuniraient avec des contre-actions strictes. Ce nouvel ensemble de lois déformées a été lentement jugée comme étant les lois de la nature, telles qu'enseignées dans les versions d'aujourd'hui de ces religions.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Spanish language
Content: The Association of Spanish Language Academies (, or ) is the entity which regulates the Spanish language. It was created in Mexico in 1951 and represents the union of all the separate academies in the Spanish-speaking world. It comprises the academies of 23 countries, ordered by date of Academy foundation: Spain (1713), Colombia (1871), Ecuador (1874), Mexico (1875), El Salvador (1876), Venezuela (1883), Chile (1885), Peru (1887), Guatemala (1887), Costa Rica (1923), Philippines (1924), Panama (1926), Cuba (1926),
Paraguay (1927), Dominican Republic (1927), Bolivia (1927), Nicaragua (1928), Argentina (1931), Uruguay (1943), Honduras (1949), Puerto Rico (1955), United States (1973) and Equatorial Guinea (2016).
The (Cervantes Institute) is a worldwide nonprofit organization created by the Spanish government in 1991. This organization has branched out in over 20 different countries, with 54 centers devoted to the Spanish and Hispanic American cultures and Spanish language. The ultimate goals of the Institute are to promote universally the education, the study, and the use of Spanish as a second language, to support methods and activities that help the process of Spanish-language education, and to contribute to the advancement of the Spanish and Hispanic American cultures in non-Spanish-speaking countries. The Institute's 2015 report "El español, una lengua viva" (Spanish, a living language) estimates that there are 559 million Spanish speakers worldwide. Among the sources cited in the report is the U.S. Census Bureau, which estimates that the U.S. will have 138 million Spanish speakers by 2050, making it the biggest Spanish-speaking nation on earth, with Spanish the mother tongue of almost a third of its citizens.

Au Nicaragua, la forme Voseo est courante, tout comme dans d'autres pays d'Amérique centrale et du Sud comme le Honduras, l'Argentine, l'Uruguay ou la Colombie côtière. L'espagnol a de nombreux dialectes différents parlés dans toute l'Amérique latine, l'espagnol d'Amérique centrale est le dialecte parlé au Nicaragua. Dans la côte des Caraïbes, de nombreux afro-Nicaraguaires et créoles parlent anglais et créole comme leur première langue. Toujours sur la côte des Caraïbes, de nombreux autochtones parlent leur langue maternelle, comme la langue Miskito, Sumo, Rama et Garifuna. De plus, de nombreux groupes ethniques au Nicaragua, comme les Nicaraguois chinois et les Nicaraguens palestiniens, ont maintenu leurs langues ancestrales, qui sont des langues minoritaires, tout en parlant espagnol et / ou anglais. Ces langues minoritaires comprennent le chinois, l'arabe, l'allemand et l'italien, entre autres.

Lin était le général qui commandait les campagnes décisives de Liaoshen et de Pingjin, dans lesquelles il a co-a conduit la victoire l'armée de campagne du champ de la Mandchou et a conduit l'Armée de libération populaire à Pékin. Il a traversé la rivière Yangtze en 1949, a battu de manière décisive le Kuomintang et a pris le contrôle des provinces côtières du sud-est de la Chine. Il s'est classé troisième parmi les dix maréchaux. Zhu De et Peng Dehuai étaient considérés comme âgés à Lin, et Lin se sont classés directement devant lui Long et Liu Bocheng.

Title: Eurasian eagle-owl
Content: The Eurasian eagle-owl ("Bubo bubo") is a species of eagle-owl that resides in much of Eurasia. It is also called the European eagle-owl and in Europe, it is occasionally abbreviated to just eagle-owl. It is one of the largest species of owl, and females can grow to a total length of 75 cm (30 in), with a wingspan of 188 cm (6 ft 2 in), males being slightly smaller. This bird has distinctive ear tufts, with upper parts that are mottled with darker blackish colouring and tawny. The wings and tail are barred. The underparts are a variably hued buff, streaked with darker colour. The facial disc is poorly developed and the orange eyes are distinctive.

Title: SS Great Eastern
Content: SS "Great Eastern" was an iron sailing steamship designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, and built by J. Scott Russell & Co. at Millwall Iron Works on the River Thames, London. She was by far the largest ship ever built at the time of her 1858 launch, and had the capacity to carry 4,000 passengers from England to Australia without refuelling. Her length of was only surpassed in 1899 by the 17,274-gross-ton RMS "Oceanic", her gross tonnage of 18,915 was only surpassed in 1901 by the 21,035-gross-ton RMS "Celtic", and her 4,000-passenger capacity was surpassed in 1913 by the 4,935-passenger SS "Imperator". The ship's five funnels were rare. These were later reduced to four.

À l'époque, Everton Football Club cherchait un mât pour son terrain d'Anfield et a par conséquent acheté son mât supérieur. Il est toujours là aujourd'hui au sol - détenu maintenant au Liverpool Football Club (formé en 1892), à la fin du Kop. En 2011, le programme Channel 4 "Time Team" a révélé que les preuves de l'enquête géophysique suggèrent que les pièces de fer résiduelles de la quille du navire et de la structure inférieure résident toujours dans l'estran.
